alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 5:58PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Narberth, National Park, East Lansdowne, Nether Providence Township, Broomall, Drexel Hill, and Newtown Square. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 21. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 338 and 339...and between mile markers 341 and 351. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 14. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
